text: Chuvash (, Čăvašla; )also known as Chăvash, Chuwash, Chovash, Chavash, Çuvaş or Çuaş is a Turkic language. It is spoken in Chuvashia, a part of central Russia. It is the only language from the Oghur branch of the Turkic languages that is still spoken today. Though many Turkic languages can be understood by different speakers, Chuvash is quite different. Chuvash is written using the Cyrillic script. Its alphabet has all of the letters of the Russian alphabet and adds four letters of its own: Ӑ, Ӗ, Ҫ and Ӳ. ==References== == Other websites == * Виталий Станьял: На чувашском конь еще не валялся... * Виталий Станьял: Решение Совета Аксакалов ЧНК Category:Chuvash Republic Category:Languages of Russia Category:Turkic languages
title: Chuvash language
